result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Pre-trial conference on November 23, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on January 9, 2023 at 10:45 am.

[MK] cases #22CF9, #22CF88, #22CF384, #22CF434 called at 4:16pm 
Defendant Dylan M. Brown in court with Attorney Ronald Sonderhouse.  ADA Jeffrey Shock in court for State of Wisconsin. 

In Cases #22CF384 and #22CF434 Prelim Waiver and Arraignment is held: 
--Mr. Brown waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.
--Service of Informations admitted, reading waived
--pleas of "not guilty" are entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.

The Court informs that the parties that these cases will be assigned to a different judge as of the judicial rotation that is scheduled for the beginning of the new year. 
The Defense provides an updated address for Mr. Brown:  N3615 County Road K, Unit A, Jefferson WI 53549. 
recess 4:25pm 

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on November 23rd at 11:00am--only counsel need to appear,  (2) Status Conference on January 9th at 10:45am

Upon Court inquiry, both parties waive Preliminary Hearing time limits.

Defendant Dylan M. Brown does not appear. Attorney Grant Alexander Erickson appears.  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
These files are scheduled for Status and an Adjourned Initial Appearance, however Att Erickson advises that the Defendant is in custody in Waukesha County.

The Court instructs the Defense to advise the JA of the Defendant's custody status two weeks prior to the next scheduled hearing so that his appearance can be effectuated.

[ml] Cases 21CF256, 22CF9, and 22CF88 called at 2:40PM
Defendant Dylan M. Brown in court with attorney Grant Alexander Erickson. ADA Krysta Parson appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court first addresses the Initial Appearances in file 22CF9:
The Court quashes the imposed and stayed warrant in file 22CF9.

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaints are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court tolls and pending time limits and sets this matter over for an Adjourned Initial Appearance.

The Court requires a $1,000.00 Signature Bond with conditions:
--no discussion of the facts of the case with the Co-Defendant
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no possession of drug paraphernalia

As to file 22CF88, Att Erickson advises that he has not had the opportunity to review the Compliant with the Defendant and requests that the Court address bond only in this file today, and set these matters over for an Adjourned Initial Appearance, with the other files to track along for general Status Conference. The State has no objection.

22CF88: 
The Court requires a $2,500.00 Signature Bond with conditions:
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no possession of drug paraphernalia

recess 2:51PM

NEXT: In 22CF88: Adjourned Initial Appearance in 03/10 at 1:15PM with in person appearances (other files to track along)

[Clerk's note, post hearing - The Defendant provided an updated address prior to the case being called. That address is as follows: N9686 County Rd SC, Watertown, WI 53094.]
